biography.bio: Elisabeth (Liesl) Handl, a young Austrian dancer-turned actress, married Austrian comedy writer-producer Walter Reisch, whose greatest Viennese film success was Maskerade (1934). In that very popular comedy, star Paula Wessely played a prim secretary named Leopoldine "Poldi" Dur, whose (fictional) name happens to coincide with the equally fictional name of a scandalous nude model -- leading to numerous misunderstandings and complications. In 1938 Mr & Mrs Reisch moved to the USA, where he enjoyed considerable success as a writer (Ninotchka) and later producer. His wife, nee Elisabeth Handl, acted small roles in a few Hollywood films, 1941-44, usually as young foreign-accented women (in one she played Hitler's niece). But for this second career, in the USA, Elisabeth (Handl) Reisch changed her name to "Poldi Dur" -- which the Reisches had lifted from the heroine of Reisch's 1934 Maskerade! (Perhaps they were trying to avoid confusion with the established actress Elissa Landi.) Just think, if Reisch had remade Maskerade in Hollywood, with his wife playing the lead role, we would have been been confronted with the mind-boggling casting of actress "Poldi Dur" playing the character "Poldi Dur".
biography.name: Poldi Dur

biography.bio: Luli Deste was born on November 7, 1901 in Vienna, Austria. She was an actress, known for Silhouetten (1936), Ski Patrol (1940) and Thank You, Madame (1936). She died on July 7, 1951 in New York City, New York, USA.
biography.name: Luli Deste

biography.bio: Fred Hennings was born on January 26, 1895 in Klagenfurt, Carinthia, Austria-Hungary as Franz von Papen-Pawlowski. He was an actor, known for Silhouetten (1936), At the Blond Katherine's (1934) and Hearts in Love (1938). He died on November 22, 1981 in Vienna, Austria.
biography.name: Fred Hennings

biography.bio: Anni Markart was born on August 5, 1907 in Frankfurt am Main, Germany. She was an actress, known for Silhouetten (1936), L'auberge du père Jonas (1931) and Die Welt ohne Maske (1934). She was married to Alexander Golling and Herbert Selpin. She died on January 23, 1991 in Munich, Germany.
biography.name: Anni Markart

biography.bio: Frauke Lauterbach is an actress, known for Fortsetzung folgt (1938), Silhouetten (1936) and Der Mann, der nicht nein sagen kann (1938).
biography.name: Frauke Lauterbach

biography.bio: Lili Marberg was born on December 9, 1876 in Grimma, Saxony, Germany. She was an actress, known for Silhouetten (1936), Az összeesküvök (1919) and Das Kriegspatenkind (1915). She was married to Karl Hans Jaray. She died on April 8, 1962 in Vienna, Austria.
biography.name: Lili Marberg

biography.bio: Fritz Imhoff, born as Friedrich Jeschke, studied at business college before taking singing and art courses. As a singer, he appeared in 1912 at the Stadttheater bei Wien. From 1920 to 1928, he played at Wiener Johann-Strauss-Theater; then six years at the Theater an der Wien, and from 1934 till 1938, at the Volksoper and in Cabarets and Varietés. In 1939 to 1944, he played at the Raimund-Theater and worked also there as the director till 1948. He began silent movies in 1929 and made more than 100 movies during his life. He had good parts in all of his Films, but some of his funny once were in La Chanson du vin nouveau (1953), Premier avril an 2000 (1952), Black on White (1943) ("Black on White"), Trip Acquaintance (1943) ("Trip Acquaintance"), Aimé des dieux (1942) ("Whom the Gods Love") and Hotel Sacher (1939).
biography.name: Fritz Imhoff

biography.bio: Ernst Arnold was born on February 12, 1892 in Vienna, Austria-Hungary as Ernst Jeschke. He was an actor and writer, known for Der Sprung in die Ehe (1919), Silhouetten (1936) and A Merry House (1939). He died on January 5, 1962 in Vienna, Austria.
biography.name: Ernst Arnold

biography.bio: Eduard Köck was an Austrian stage and film actor. He was born in Innsbruck, studied there at the University and played on stage. He became a member of the Exl-Bühne, which had his headquarters in Tirol and also became famous in foreign countries. His first film was in 1913. In 1943 he played in "Der ewige Klang" with Elfriede Datzig and Olga Tschechowa.
biography.name: Eduard Köck

biography.bio: Toni Birkmayer is known for his work on Silhouetten (1936), The Fairy Dolly (1936) and Franz Schubert (1953).
biography.name: Toni Birkmayer

biography.placeOfBirth: Atzgersdorf, Lower Austria, Austria-Hungary [now Vienna, Austria]
biography.bio: Karl Skraup was born on July 31, 1898 in Atzgersdorf, Lower Austria, Austria-Hungary. He was an actor, known for Lowlands (1954), The World Turns Backward (1947) and La Reine de la route (1948). He died on October 2, 1958 in Munich, Germany.
biography.name: Karl Skraup

biography.bio: Hedy Pfundmeyer was born on December 1, 1899 in Vienna, Austria. She is known for her work on Silhouetten (1936), Le masque d'épouvante (1927) and Lucifer (1921). She died on November 5, 1965 in Vienna.
biography.name: Hedy Pfundmeyer

biography.bio: Mila Cirul is an actress, known for Silhouetten (1936).
biography.name: Mila Cirul

biography.bio: Willy Fränzl is an actor, known for Silhouetten (1936).
biography.name: Willy Fränzl

biography.bio: Liesl Temple is an actress, known for Silhouetten (1936).
biography.name: Liesl Temple
